meanings.definition: To accompany or guide someone as an escort.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys escoting her grandmother to the park every Sunday.
meanings.sent2: The bodyguard was escoting the celebrity through the crowded event.
meanings.sent3: The penguin insisted on escoting the fish to the party.
meanings.sent4: The flashlight was escoting us through the dark cave like a loyal companion.
meanings.sent5: The friendly dog was escoting the lost child back to his family.

meanings.definition: The act of accompanying or guiding someone as an escort.
meanings.sent1: The escoting of the VIP guests was handled by the security team.
meanings.sent2: She felt honored to be chosen for the escoting of the important diplomat.
meanings.sent3: The little duckling's escoting of the butterfly was quite a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight served as a gentle escoting for the travelers in the night.
meanings.sent5: The escoting of the bride down the aisle was a beautiful moment at the wedding.
